title: Review and setlist: Chris Stapleton brings the blues to Mohegan Sun Arena
author: Chris Stevens
bullets: Chris Stapleton performed at Mohegan Sun Arena, delivering a mix of blues, ballads, and rock, to a sold-out crowd.
Stapleton was accompanied by an eight-piece band, including his wife Morgane, with notable musicians Paul Franklin and Lee Pardini.
Fan favorites such as 'Tennessee Whiskey' and 'Traveller' were featured, with Stapleton showcasing his vocal dynamics and guitar skills.

title: 8 possible cut or trade candidates for Patriots ahead of NFL free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Stefon Diggs could be cut to save the Patriots $16.8 million despite his strong performance and connection with Drake Maye.
DeMario Douglas, Mack Hollins, and Kayshon Boutte could be cut or traded to free up $3-$4 million each in cap space.
Christian Barmore and Christian Elliss are potential cut candidates due to legal issues and cap considerations, despite their on-field contributions.

title: Jayson Tatum won’t make return from Achilles tear in Celtics’ matchup vs. 76ers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jayson Tatum will not play against the 76ers as he continues recovering from a right Achilles tendon injury.
Baylor Scheierman is questionable with a thumb fracture; Joel Embiid is out with an oblique strain.
The Celtics have won eight of their last ten games and face Philadelphia, ending their regular-season matchup.

title: Jarren Duran’s hot start to spring training continues, hitting 2 homers vs. Twins. What could it mean for Red Sox’ lineup?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jarren Duran hit two home runs against the Twins, totaling three homers in the first week of spring training.
Duran's performance against lefties is notable, given his past struggles with a career .232 average and .620 OPS against them.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora sees Duran's strong showing as a potential option for the three spot in the batting order.

title: As 2025-26 Bruins exceed expectations, so has their prospect pool in college hockey
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins prospects James Hagens and Dean Letourneau have scored 39 goals for Boston College this season.
In a game against Boston University, Letourneau scored BC's only goal, assisted by Hagens.
The Bruins' organizational future strengthens with college prospects like Hagens and Letourneau showing significant development.

title: Celtics ‘clear pick’ to win the East? One NBA assistant coach reportedly feels that way
author: Conor Roche
bullets: An unnamed NBA assistant coach considers the Boston Celtics favorites to win the Eastern Conference despite trailing the Pistons.
The Celtics boast a 39-20 record and league-leading net rating since Thanksgiving, placing second in the Eastern Conference.
Celtics' Jaylen Brown averages 29.1 points per game, contributing to Boston's strong offensive performance without Jayson Tatum.

title: Review and setlist: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit bring a well-rounded Americana showcase to Boston
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit performed at the Boch Center Wang Theatre on February 27, blending Americana, rock, and folk.
The band played a mix of hits like 'Super 8' and deeper cuts, showcasing Isbell's lyrical depth and musical versatility.
The concert included tracks from all stages of Isbell's career, including songs from his time with the Drive-By Truckers.

title: Latest reports suggest Patriots are unlikely to land big-name edge rusher before NFL Draft
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots unlikely to acquire top edge rushers like Trey Hendrickson or Jaelan Phillips due to high costs.
Raiders currently not in hurry to trade Maxx Crosby before NFL Draft despite trade speculation.
Patriots could target Missouri edge rusher Zion Young with 31st pick in NFL Draft.

title: What Paramount’s pending purchase of Warner Bros. Discovery means for sports fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Paramount Skydance to purchase Warner Bros. Discovery for $110 billion, pending regulatory approval.
CBS and TNT/TBS likely to integrate, affecting sports broadcasts like NCAA and MLB.
NFL could sell more games to streaming platforms; Netflix pursuing live sports rights aggressively.

title: Patriots reportedly interested in A.J. Brown, but not at Eagles’ current asking price
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots are interested in trading for A.J. Brown, but find the Eagles' current asking price too high.
Philadelphia faces financial challenges trading Brown before June 1 due to potential dead money impacts.
Mike Vrabel acknowledges trade talks, while New England explores keeping Stefon Diggs alongside Brown.
